unitree_legged_sdk.example_py.Bezier.Behavior_Walking_2_bits¶

class unitree_legged_sdk.example_py.Bezier.Behavior_Walking_2_bits.Behavior_Walking_2_bits(trajectories)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to simulate the walking behavior of a robot using a simple 2-bit finite state machine.

The Behavior_Walking_2_bits class manages a set of neural network counters and activity detectors to simulate walking behavior. The walking pattern is controlled by sensory inputs and the state of the system, which determines the next movement command.

sensor_stack¶

A stack to store sensory information, starting with “FL foot detected”.

Type

list of str

counters¶

A list of 1-bit counters used in the simulation.

Type

list of Counter_1_bit

sim_index¶

A list of simulation indices, initialized to 0 for each counter.

Type

list of int

inputs¶

A list of input arrays for each counter, generated by build_inputs.

Type

list of numpy.ndarray

V¶

A list of voltage matrices for each counter, generated by build_V.

Type

list of list of numpy.ndarray

ready_for_command¶

A flag indicating whether the system is ready to receive a new command, initialized to True.

Type

bool

acts¶

A list of activity detectors associated with each counter.

Type

list of Activity_Detector

trajectories¶

A dictionary containing the movement trajectories for each part of the robot.

Type

dict

MAX_SIM_TIME = 40000¶
build_V()[source]¶

Builds the voltage matrices for each counter over the maximum simulation time.

Returns

A list of voltage matrices for each counter.

Return type

list of list of numpy.ndarray

build_inputs()[source]¶

Builds the input arrays for each counter over the maximum simulation time.

Returns

A list of input arrays for each counter.

Return type

list of numpy.ndarray

get_next_state(instruction)[source]¶

Advances the state of the counters based on the given instruction.

Parameters

instruction (list of int) – A list of instructions for each counter; 1 to increment, 0 to do nothing.

initial_read_states()[source]¶

Placeholder for reading initial states of the system.

parts = ['FR', 'FL', 'RR', 'RL']¶
push(sensory_info)[source]¶

Pushes new sensory information onto the stack.

Parameters

sensory_info (str) – The sensory information to push onto the stack.

read_states()[source]¶

Placeholder for reading the current states of the system.

res = 0.1¶
set_new_command()[source]¶

Sets a new command based on the sensory input and current state of the system.

Returns

A dictionary with the trajectories for each part, or an empty list if no command is ready.

Return type

dict or list

set_ready(ready)[source]¶

Sets the readiness of the system to receive new commands.

Parameters

ready (bool) – True if ready to receive new commands, False otherwise.
